disease.description: Scurvy is a disease caused by a severe deficiency of vitamin C (ascorbic acid), which is vital for the production of collagen in the body. It can lead to anemia, weakness, gum disease, and skin problems.
symptoms: Small red or purple spots on the skin
treatment: Eating vitamin C-rich foods (oranges, lemons, strawberries, bell peppers)

locations: Any general healthcare provider or hospital with a focus on nutritional deficiencies

preventionTips: Maintain a diet rich in fruits and vegetables that contain vitamin C
disease.costEstimate: Low, generally under $20 for treatment with supplements

disease.description: Appendicitis is the inflammation of the appendix, a small tube connected to the large intestine. If untreated, the appendix can burst and cause life-threatening infection.
symptoms: Severe pain in the lower right abdomen

locations: General hospitals with emergency surgical care

preventionTips: There are no specific prevention measures for appendicitis

disease.description: Rickets is a skeletal disorder caused by a lack of vitamin D, calcium, or phosphate. It leads to softening and weakening of the bones, primarily in children.
treatment: Dietary changes to include vitamin D-rich foods

locations: Pediatric hospitals or clinics with focus on nutritional deficiencies and bone health

preventionTips: Ensure adequate vitamin D through diet or sunlight
Give children vitamin D supplements as needed

disease.description: Anemia is a condition in which the blood doesn't have enough healthy red blood cells or hemoglobin. This leads to reduced oxygen flow to the body's organs, causing fatigue and other symptoms.
preventionTips: Eat a diet rich in iron, folate, and B12
Take supplements if recommended by a healthcare provider
disease.recoveryTime: Varies based on the cause and treatment of anemia
disease.costEstimate: $50-$500 depending on the severity and treatment

disease.description: Asthma is a chronic lung disease that inflames and narrows the airways, making it difficult to breathe. Asthma can be triggered by allergens, exercise, cold air, or stress.
preventionTips: Use prescribed asthma medication as directed
Maintain a healthy lifestyle to support lung health
disease.recoveryTime: Ongoing management; asthma is a chronic condition
disease.costEstimate: $50-$300 per month for inhalers and medication

disease.description: Pneumonia is an infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs, which can fill with fluid. It can be caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi, and is more severe in young children, the elderly, and individuals with weakened immune systems.

locations: Hospitals, urgent care centers, general healthcare providers
